title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, it should be confirmed that the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, it is not confirmed whether the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt.
EB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, a confirmation should be displayed to ensure that the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt.
SR:
1. Open the application.
2. Create a new project.
3. Specify an existing directory structure.
4. Point the output folder to a bin directory that contains more than just .class files.
5. Confirm that a message is displayed, asking if the output directory can be deleted and then rebuilt.
6. Proceed with the project creation process.
